alert.note: Alert for Kings; Mariposa; Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 6:58AM PST until March 10 at 11:15AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kings, Madera, Mariposa, Merced and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 300 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 656 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Isolated thunderstorms that will produce additional heavy rainfall are also expected at times. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Visalia, Clovis, Merced, Madera, Hanford, Atwater, Los Banos, Corcoran, Lemoore, Sanger, Reedley, Selma, Dinuba, Chowchilla, Avenal, Parlier, Kerman, Coalinga and Livingston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
